description: UpdateContinuousBackups enables or disables point in time recovery for the specified table. A successful UpdateContinuousBackups call returns the current ContinuousBackupsDescription. Continuous backups are ENABLED on all tables at table creation. If point in time recovery is enabled, PointInTimeRecoveryStatus will be set to ENABLED. Once continuous backups and point in time recovery are enabled, you can restore to any point in time within EarliestRestorableDateTime and LatestRestorableDateTime. LatestRestorableDateTime is typically 5 minutes before the current time. You can restore your table to any point in time in the last 35 days. You can set the RecoveryPeriodInDays to any value between 1 and 35 days.

parameters.name: TableName
parameters.description: The name of the table. You can also provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the table in this parameter.

parameters.name: PointInTimeRecoverySpecification
parameters.description: Represents the settings used to enable point in time recovery. Indicates whether point in time recovery is enabled (true) or disabled (false) on the table. RecoveryPeriodInDays (integer) --- The number of preceding days for which continuous backups are taken and maintained. Your table data is only recoverable to any point-in-time from within the configured recovery period. This parameter is optional. If no value is provided, the value will default to 35.

nested_items.name: ContinuousBackupsDescription
nested_items.description: Represents the continuous backups and point in time recovery settings on the table.

nested_items.name: ContinuousBackupsStatus
nested_items.description: ContinuousBackupsStatus can be one of the following states: ENABLED, DISABLED.

nested_items.name: PointInTimeRecoveryDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the point in time recovery settings applied to the table.

nested_items.name: PointInTimeRecoveryStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of point in time recovery:
ENABLED - Point in time recovery is enabled.
DISABLED - Point in time recovery is disabled.

nested_items.name: RecoveryPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The number of preceding days for which continuous backups are taken and maintained. Your table data is only recoverable to any point-in-time from within the configured recovery period. This parameter is optional.

nested_items.name: EarliestRestorableDateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the earliest point in time you can restore your table to. You can restore your table to any point in time during the last 35 days.

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableDateTime
nested_items.description: LatestRestorableDateTime is typically 5 minutes before the current time.
